meanings.definition: To assert a claim in opposition to a claim made by someone else.
meanings.sent1: She counterclaimed the accusation of theft by stating she was innocent.
meanings.sent2: The defendant counterclaimed the plaintiff's allegations in court.
meanings.sent3: When accused of eating the last cookie, Tim counterclaimed that it must have been the dog.
meanings.sent4: The waves counterclaimed the shore, each one trying to overpower the other.
meanings.sent5: The rival company counterclaimed with a lawsuit of their own, escalating the legal battle.
